CatDescriptText: Mrs. Emma Wesley, 411 Michigan Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 3, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Who do you think is responsible for the failure to pass effective civil rights legislation in Congress?"  Answer reads: "The people are responsible, because if they tell the Congressmen how to vote, the law-makers will vote that way."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Emma Wesley standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Thrift Drugs store in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
